==Descriptions==
{{Description|The palace located at the top of Sumeru City. It is believed to be the residence of the current Dendro Archon, "[[Lesser Lord Kusanali]]." No one apart from the sages of the Akademiya has ever seen this deity with their own eyes for the last few hundred years.|[[Map]] description}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology=== 
* ''Sura'' {{lang||sa=शूर}} means "god" or "deity" in ''Sanskrit'' and ''Sthāna'' {{lang||sa=स्थान}} refers to "a temple". ''Surasthāna'' can mean "temple", "devotional place" or "residence of God".<ref>Wisdom Library: [https://www.wisdomlib.org/definition/surasthana Surasthana]</ref>
